home.title: Find joy again, like the phoenix rising

fields.tagline: Find joy again, like the phoenix rising
fields.bio: Dr Graeme Bishop is a Medical Doctor and has worked for companies for many years and has a wealth of experience regarding Burnout. He has experience in many other areas of medicine and he will be providing a lot of regular advice on Facebook and Youtube to help sufferers of Burnout.
fields.whatIsBurnout: Burnout (often work related, but not always) is the result of chronic stress ,and results in emotional and physical Tiredness, Cynicism about work and life, and Ineffectiveness in accomplishing tasks. It usually involves elements of anxiety and mild depression. However severe depression is more serious than even Burnout.

fields.title: Phase 5
fields.feedback:
Thank you for completing the Quiz and here are your results.

You are suffering from Severe Burnout. You will be feeling exhausted mentally and physically and have lost enthusiasm for work and life. You feel very anxious in the morning at the thought of work. You feel disillusioned about work and have a loss of confidence in yourself. Work and maybe life isn’t meaningful. There is a mismatch in one or more of these areas of work, such as for example Workload or Meaning or Rewards.

It is common to feel anxious and even a little depressed. However it is important to realise that moderate or severe depression is more than just Burnout and requires immediate medical attention. If you are a perfectionist or tend to be pessimistic you will be more likely to suffer from Burnout. Your work life balance is not good and it is important that you are able to “recharge your batteries”. This means taking regular breaks between work and regular holidays. Good sleep , good diet and regular exercise are very important for you to cope with life's challenges and important for your immune system. This helps with resistance to infections and possibly cancer. Spend time with people that are positive and don’t neglect your interesting hobbies such as fishing,music or exercise. Limit time with people who are negative.

This stage of Burnout is serious and you need to take urgent action to return the joy to your life otherwise your health is in danger. However it is reversible with proper management and you can still regain the joy in your life and work. However is very important to get help at this stage.

For ongoing information subscribe to my You tube channel and Facebook group. I am working on a comprehensive course to deal with managing Burnout.

fields.title: Phase 4
fields.feedback:
Thank you for completing the Quiz and here are your results.

You are suffering from moderate Burnout. You probably feel exhausted mentally and physically and have lost a lot of enthusiasm for work and life. You feel anxious in the morning at the thought of work. You feel disillusioned about work and have some loss of confidence in yourself. Work and maybe life isn’t as meaningful as it used to be. There may be a mismatch in one or more of these areas of work such as Workload or Meaning or Rewards.

It is common to feel anxious and down. If you are a perfectionist or tend to be pessimistic you will be more likely to suffer from Burnout. Your work life balance is not as good as it should be and it is important that you are able to “recharge your batteries”. This means taking regular breaks between work and regular holidays. Good sleep, good diet and regular exercise are very important for you to cope with life's challenges and important for your immune system. This helps with resistance to infections and possibly cancer. Spend time with people that are positive and don’t neglect your interesting hobbies such as fishing,music or exercise. Limit time with people who are negative. It is important to monitor your levels of energy, enthusiasm and effectiveness at work and address problem areas at work that are getting out of hand.

This is an important stage of Burnout because if it isn’t dealt with you will only get worse. However it is reversible with proper management and you can still regain the joy in your life and work. It is very important to get help at this stage.

For ongoing information subscribe to my You tube channel and Facebook group. I am working on a comprehensive course course to deal with managing Burnout.

fields.title: Phase 3
fields.feedback:
Thank you for completing the Burnout Quiz and here are your results.

Your results show that you are suffering from low levels of Burnout, although this may be moderate if you scored highly in any questions.

You have problems at work and your work life balance is not as good as it should be. The key signs of Burnout which you may be experiencing are Tiredness both physical and emotional. Cynicism where you are not as tolerant of people at work and in your life generally, and Ineffectiveness where you are not as productive as you should be and you begin to doubt your abilities. You don’t have the energy and enthusiasm you should have but you try to compensate by working harder.

It is important to check for further advice if you scored highly in one or more questions.

You are not as enthusiastic or energetic as you used to be. If you are a perfectionist or tend to be pessimistic you will be more likely to suffer from Burnout. Your work life balance is not as good as it should be and it is important that you are able to “recharge your batteries”. This means taking regular breaks between work and regular holidays.

Good sleep, good diet and regular exercise are very important for you to cope with life's challenges and important for your immune system. This helps with resistance to infections and possibly cancer. Spend time with people that are positive and don’t neglect your interesting hobbies such as fishing,music or exercise. Limit time with people who are negative. It is important to monitor your levels of energy , enthusiasm and effectiveness at work and address problem areas at work that are getting out of hand. This is an important stage of Burnout because if it isn’t dealt with you will only get worse. However it is reversible with proper management and you can still regain the joy in your life and work.

For ongoing information subscribe to my You tube channel and Facebook group.I am however working on a comprehensive management system for treating Burnout, in case you are interested or know someone that is suffering from Burnout.

fields.title: Phase 2
fields.feedback:
Thank you for completing the Burnout Questionnaire and here are your results.

You could be suffering from low levels of burnout but generally you are functioning well. It is important to check for further advice if you scored highly in one or more questions. You are not as enthusiastic or energetic as you used to be. If you are a perfectionist or tend to be pessimistic you will be more likely to suffer from Burnout. Your work life balance is possibly not as good as it should be and it is important that you are able to “recharge your batteries”. This means taking regular breaks between work and regular holidays.

Good sleep, good diet and regular exercise are very important for you to cope with life's challenges and important for your immune system. This helps with resistance to infections and possibly cancer. Spend time with people that are positive and don’t neglect your interesting hobbies such as fishing,music or exercise. Limit time with people who are negative. It is important to monitor your levels of energy, enthusiasm and effectiveness at work and address problem areas at work that are getting out of hand. Look out for the next stage of Burnout where you begin to feel tired, a bit cynical and not as effective as you used to be.

For ongoing information subscribe to my You tube channel and Facebook group. I am however working on a comprehensive management system for treating Burnout, in case you are interested or know someone that is suffering from Burnout.

fields.title: Phase 1
fields.feedback:
Thank you for completing the Burnout Quiz and here are your results.

You are not suffering from Burnout although if you scored highly in one question you need to be aware of the warning signs. This can sometimes be the “Honeymoon phase” where your energy levels and enthusiasm are high and as long as you don’t think you are “bullet proof” this can continue.

Your work life balance is good and you are able to “recharge your batteries”. This means taking regular breaks between work and regular holidays. Good sleep, good diet and regular exercise are very important for you to cope with life's challenges and important for your immune system. This helps with resistance to infections and possibly cancer.

Spend time with people that are positive and don’t neglect interesting hobbies such as fishing,music or exercise. Limit time with people who are negative.

For ongoing information subscribe to my Youtube channel and Facebook group. I am however working on a comprehensive management system for treating Burnout, in case you are interested or know someone that is suffering from Burnout.
